Description: Disc-shaped spindle-whorls made of a greyish-green granite, with a perforation that is slightly off centre. On the upper side traces from drilling in a funnel shape ending in a vertical drill hole. The cylindrical part is highly smoothed probably from the usage of the object. Upper- and underside are well smoothed and shows several chipped markings. The section is rectangular with rounded edges. Possible a spindle whorl.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E12.2, accessed from Level 3, E13.1A
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 185)
